name: The Black Sorrows
description: '''The Black Sorrows''' are an Australian [[blues rock]] band formed in 1983 by mainstay vocalist [[Joe Camilleri]] (ex-[[Jo Jo Zep & The Falcons]]), who also plays saxophone and guitar. Camilleri has used various line-ups to record 17 albums, with five reaching the top 20 on the [[ARIA Charts|ARIA Albums Charts]]: ''[[Hold On to Me (album)|Hold on to Me]]'' (September 1988), ''[[Harley and Rose]]'' (August 1990), ''[[Better Times (album)|Better Times]]'' (September 1992), ''[[The Chosen Ones - Greatest Hits]]'' (November 1993) and ''[[Lucky Charm (album)|Lucky Charm]]'' (November 1994). Their top 40 singles are "[[Chained to the Wheel]]" (February 1989), "[[Harley + Rose]]" (August 1990) and "[[Snake Skin Shoes]]" (July 1994).
